fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5783].
{panel}

*Original request description:*

The reporter can not add an issue when he has no resolve permissions and the "fixed Version" field is a required field.

As a JIRA Administrator I want a "Fixed version" to be a required field when resolving. But it seems illogical that someone reporting an issue should enter the field. This applies to other fields as well.
h3. Workaround

The [JIRA Suite Utilities|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.googlecode.jira-suite-utilities] provides a [fields required validator|https://jsutil.atlassian.net/wiki/display/JSUTIL/JIRA+Suite+Utilities+Workflow+Validators#JIRASuiteUtilitiesWorkflowValidators-FieldsRequiredValidator] that can be configured to set fields required on specific transitions.
fields.summary: Make field required only for one state transition

fields.description:
Currently you are unable to restrict a search ( and hence filter ) by project category. This means you can't set up filters and then dashboard widgets that only apply to projects in a partciular category. 

For example I might want multiple dashboards - one for each project category, but you can't restrict searches by category - so option remains a single project or all projects.
fields.summary: Ability to create searches/filters on project categories

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5778].
  {panel}

Currently, we don't have a reliably means to communicate with our customers.  We should have an admin portlet that uses a service to download RSS from the JIRA site.  This will allow us to inform people of bug fixes, promotions etc.

The RSS url should include the product & version etc in the URL, but no other identifying information.  

eg:

http://www.atlassian.com/rss/jira-feed.xml?version=2.6.1&edition=standard

Perhaps this can be a specific type of a more general RSS portlet?
fields.summary: RSS feed of JIRA news

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5773].
  {panel}

It requires to add notification scheme for attaching event.

Reason;
Attaching event is special situation comparing normal update.

The following comment is by Jeff when I request support in http://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-846.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Comment by Jeff Turner [25/Jan/05 10:37 PM] [ Permlink ] 
Hi, 

Currently the number and types of events are hardcoded, so it would not 
be possible without modifying the source substantially. I had to do it 
recently, and here is the list of files modified: 

notification-events.xml 
com/atlassian/jira/event/issue/IssueEventDispatcher.java 
com/atlassian/jira/event/issue/IssueEventListener.java 
com/atlassian/jira/event/issue/IssueEventType.java 
com/atlassian/jira/event/listeners/DebugListener.java 
atlassian/jira/event/listeners/cache/IssueCacheListener.java 
om/atlassian/jira/event/listeners/mail/MailListener.java 
com/atlassian/jira/event/listeners/mail/MailNotifications.java 
com/atlassian/jira/event/listeners/search/IssueIndexListener.java 
com/atlassian/jira/mail/MailThreadManager.java 
com/atlassian/jira/mail/MailThreadManagerImpl.java 

If you could raise a feature request on http://jira.atlassian.com we can 
look into supporting this natively. 


Cheers, 
Jeff

fields.description:
Embedding piece of XML containing CDATA section in "description" field caused SAX parser to fail.

To reproduce this bug:

1. Establish jira instance with working backup/restore mechanism.
2. Enter new issue with description containing following text:

<Err_Msg><![CDATA[WM returned error 3 [OutDoc::initFromXML:No processing 
instruction starts with 'xml']]]></Err_Msg>

3. Do backup.
4. Try to restore - jira will return: Exception occurred: org.xml.sax.SAXParseException: The element type "description" must be terminated by the matching end-tag "</description>".
fields.summary: Issue description with XML elements breaks backups

fields.description:
One of our users created an issue with several screen shots (.JPGs) attached to it. The issue was created in the wrong project, so the project lead moved the issue to the correct project. Once in the new project, the links for the issue were still present, but the images and thumbnails were gone.

Our JIRA system administrator copied the thumbnails and image files from the old issue folder to the new issue folder. Everything seems fine now. So, we have a workaround, but no idea why the problem occurred.

Thanks for your help.

--
Geoff Wass
Montreal, Quebec, Canada

When use mysql as datasource, an error occur when startup:
2005-01-27 13:21:10,734 [core.entity.jdbc.DatabaseUtil] SQL Exception while exec
uting the following:
CREATE TABLE version (ID DECIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, PROJECT DECIMAL(18,0), vname VA
RCHAR(255), DESCRIPTION TEXT, SEQUENCE DECIMAL(18,0), RELEASED VARCHAR(10), ARCH
IVED VARCHAR(10), URL VARCHAR(255), RELEASEDATE DATETIME, CONSTRAINT PK_version
PRIMARY KEY (ID))
Error was: java.sql.SQLException: Syntax error or access violation,  message fro
m server: "You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that correspon
ds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'version (ID DE
CIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, PROJECT DECIMAL(18,0), vname VARCHAR(255), D' at line 1"

It seems mysql reject "version" as table name, so I have to create table manually:

CREATE TABLE jira.version(ID DECIMAL(18,0) NOT NULL, PROJECT DECIMAL(18,0), vname VARCHAR(255), DESCRIPTION TEXT, SEQUENCE DECIMAL(18,0), RELEASED VARCHAR(10), ARCHIVED VARCHAR(10), URL VARCHAR(255), RELEASEDATE DATETIME, 
CONSTRAINT PK_version PRIMARY KEY (ID));


So when add "databaseName." before table name "version" (like jira.version), MySQL create the table correctly.

fields.description:
I believe there is a flaw in group-oriented security. I've found a workaround, but it was by chance and would have otherwise meant a major retooling of our planning JIRA deployment.

GOAL
To have a system where customers see only their own issues, and not issues posted by other customers.

METHODOLOGY
I have created customer specific groups, let's call them CustomerA and CustomerB. Our client accounts are added to these groups. I have also created an Issue Security Scheme for the project and, among other permission settings such as Default and Public, I've added a security setting for each such group. Default grants visibility to the Reporter, Public grants it to jira-users, CustomerA grants it to the CustomerA group as well as development, etc.

EXPECTED RESULTS
Customers with accounts that belong to the CustomerA group should only see other CustomerA-related issues.

ACTUAL RESULTS
People in CustomerA group see no issues whatsoever.

WORKAROUND
For each customer-oriented Issue Security Level (e.g. CustomerA) add "Reporter" to the group. If this is done, anyone in CustomerA can see other CustomerA issues, even though they were not the reporter and may have never reported any issues.

PROPOSED SOLUTION
Modify the security system so that it no longer requires Reporter to be present in order to see issues reported by users in the same group.
fields.summary: Group-oriented security has a flaw

fields.description:
I've found a situation in which very long and nasty errors (see below for an example) can appear on the login page because of some filter / default dashboard configurations. Here are the preconditions:

1. I have a filter called "My Current Tasks" that lists all tasks assigned to a user on a given release of a specific project.

2. I have put this filter on the default dashboard as a Filter Statistic, sorted by Priority... this shows the user a nice little bar graph of how many issues are assigned to them by priority.

3. The filter is of course shared with either A) the development group or B) everyone.

EXPECTED RESULTS
The bar graph should appear on the default dashboard for any user that is logged in. If (A) above, then non-developers should not see the portlet at all, since the driving filter is not shared.

ACTUAL RESULTS
On the login page if (A) above, I see a "This portlet is no longer valid as the associated filter could not be retrieved." If (B) above, I get a very, very long Java exception on the login page that looks hideous and scares people off.

Also, if (A) above and the user logs in, developers see what is expected but non-developers see "This portlet is no longer valid as the associated filter could not be retrieved" on their dashboard. If (B) and the user logs in, it looks fine although the portlet appears with zero statistics for non-developers (of course).

RECOMMENDED SOLUTION
The dashboard (and login page!) should not try to run portlets that are driven by filters that are hidden to the current user.

EXCEPTION TRACE FROM LOGIN PAGE
This is obviously just a nasty side effect, but I've marked this as a Critical issue because this is what we get on our login page, for all to see:

fields.description:
Unable to import XML from Jira Production environment to Development.

I take a cut of our live project twice a day and import it into Dev. Two days ago this failed and I have not been able to do it since. I use the cut and paste from export to import windows.  The XML we are trying to import has been sent in a seperate mail (dated 26.1.2004) from scott.burgess@genworth.com as I dont want the project posted here.

The error which is thrown on the Import page is :Form Errors: Exception occurred: java.io.CharConversionException: stream:6660: illegal utf8 encoding 0xc2 

I sent you this bug in an e-mail on Mon 24/01/2005 at 17:03 but I did't get a reply yet. It is my most urgent concern as I am not confident that I can back up my production environment successfully. We are using Resin 3.0.9 on development and 3.0.7 on Production but I don't think that would cause the issue. The two error logs associated with the thrown error are attached: stderr shows just errors and stdout shows all log activity from Resin. The logs were reset just prior to the error being thrown. I have sent the error logs in the same mail as above.

fields.description:
I found that certain unresolved issues which appeard in ALL, did not appear anywhere else, like under open issues byu assignee.  The only other way to access the issue was to directly key issue # into quick search.
We found teh issues to have a due year of "0005" instead of "2005".  I tried to reproduce this by entereing 05 and 0005 into year portion of due date but I kept getting errors.

This is CRITICAL as it means we cannot rely on Jira to track our issues without inadevrtantly dropping one or 2 or 3 or 20 ....

Due date of parent task = last due date of subtasks

fields.description: If no SMTP server has been configured, then the Support Request page will clearly not work.  However absolutely no indication of this is given to the user. After submitting a support request, one gets back the happy "Your support request email has been successfully sent" message regardless of whether the message on the queue is ever processed.
fields.summary: Support Request page should notify user if no SMTP server exists

fields.description:
Notifications should respect Permission Schemes associated with project.

For example, when moving an issue to another project in which the reporter does not have access, the reporter will still receive email notifications of issue updates.

At present, the 'Comment Viewable' level is respected. In the long term, the best solution would most likely take a hierarchical form - with each level over-riding its parent level - e.g.:

Global Permissions
Project Permissions
'Comment Viewable' permissions.
fields.summary: Notifications should respect Permission Schemes associated with project.

fields.description: I upgraded to Enterprise 3.0.3 and I reindexed  all the images does not appear in the pages. I cannot see issue icons, and other images as well.
fields.summary: i upgraded to 3.0.3 and reindexed but all the images does not appear

fields.description:
Today it is not possible to the same custom field for multiple issue types.

I would suggest a multi-select list at custom field definition, which allows to select more than one issue type, for which the custom field works.

Why is this useful?
My problem: I needed a field "price", where i can put down, what an "Improvement" OR "New Feature" the customer costs. So i created a field "price" for "Improvement", and then i had to create a second field "price"  for "New Feature".

That's bad for searching and sorting a list, which consists of New Features and Improvements as price is being displayed in different columns.

So haveing one costum field for multiple issue types would be a great thing!
fields.summary: custom fields for multiple issue types

fields.description:
I have a pretty default Jira Professional Setup.  
How do I tell how many bugs a developer has Resolved?
Typically a Tester enters a bug, a developer Resolves it and then a Tester Closes/Reopens it.

So for bugs in the Resolved (Asignee = tester) & Closed (Asignee still = tester) States, how do I count how many bugs individual developers have fixed?

Many Thanks,

Ross.
fields.summary: How To Tell How Many Issues A Developer Has Resolved

fields.description:
It's impossible to edit an issue that is closed, even if the user has the "edit issue" permission.

Is it a hard coded control ?

If yes, how can we deactivate it ?
If not, it's then a bug. How can we workaround this problem ?
fields.summary: Allow administrator to configure when an issue is not editable because it is closed

fields.description:
If user will add attachment with space on filename end (e.g. because he used copy & paste from TotalCommander), attachment is not visible and downloadable

1) Operation / Attach file

2) User will copy and paste full pathname to attachment on his loacl HDD, e.g. from Total Commander - i.e. select attachment, click Ctrl+Shift+Enter, left arrow (full path name on TotalCmd command line will be selected - with space on end !), Ctrl+C - copy to clipboard, switch to JIRA, Ctrl+V - paste full pathname 
with space on end - e.g. "N:\_Proj\__RBT-lnk\Logs\iter-1\09-ts-1059\ts-1059.jpg "

3) in Manage Attachments window is attachment shown, but not on Issue detail page

4) if user click on "download" link in "Manage Attachments" page exception is shown:

404 Could not find specified attachment
/jira/secure/attachment/14694/ts-1059.jpg was not found on this server. 
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resin-3.0.10 (built Mon, 20 Dec 2004 01:12:17 PST) 

-------
5) on target filesystem is file saved with space on end

6) in 2.6.1 Enterprise it worked well (spaces were probably trimmed)
fields.summary: Attachment with space on end will not work
Handle INLINE attachments not only ATTACHMENT

fields.description:
It came to my notice that the "Support Request" which is built into Jira to raise requests is NOT working. 

I tried the following 2 excercise:

1) The "to" field has the default mail id as "jira-support@atlassian.com" and the "cc" has a default of "preetham@centrata.com" and the "contact email" has "preetham@centrata.com". I leave the defaults as is and fill up the rest of the details (and also un-check the "Data Export" field). When I submit this form, I DO NOT receive a CC mail. I do not know if jira-support@atlassian.com is receiving a mail or not. I guess apparently NOT because I have not received any mail back from them in the past week.

2) Interestingly, If i change the "to" field to "preetham@centrata.com" and the cc is also "preetham@centrata.com", I get a mail back to me ???

Kindly help...
fields.summary: Jira "Support Request" from Admin Panel NOT working

When defining components you can use more than 60 characters. 
In the filtering section you can only see 25 characters. This is not enough to distinguish between the different components.
It is impossible to filter for components in some of the project at the moment.

some examples of thes components:
1.04. Modules - Fakturatie  
1.04.01. Modules - Fakturering - Fakturering 
1.04.03. Modules - Fakturering - Schrappen facturen 
1.04.04. Modules - Fakturering - Overzicht
1.04.05. Modules - Fakturering - Lijst geschrap 

cheers,

Johan

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5721].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update: 23rd December 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA|titleColor=#FFFFFF}
Hi all,

Thanks for participating in this issue, either by voting, commented or just watching. We highly value your feedback in all forms, and through suggestions in jira.atlassian.com is not different. We use this channel often to learn the best we can with how customers use JIRA and how we can continue to improve the experience for as many users as possible.

We have revisited this issue again recently and wanted to reiterate that there are still currently no plans to implement this suggestion, and it is not currently on any JIRA team’s roadmap at this stage. 

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Kerrod Williams
Kerrod (dot) Williams (at) atlassian (dot) com
Product Manager, JIRA

{panel}

One of the configuration difficulities with JIRA and it's 'silo' project structure is how mapping/coordinating across multiple projects is very troublesome.

One Example of this are an enterprise software product where individual modules are mapped onto projects yet the product as a whole has no central control point. 

Another example is a consulting organization working on several different projects with the same client, or one project with multiple deliverables.

One fix for this would be to extend the categorizations available for individual projects onto project categories - essentially nesting projects - where each individual project has it's versions and components yet the project category can have a overall view of deliverables.

Such a feature would quickly create demand for 'views' similiar to those available for JIRA projects today - roadmaps, issues by user, filtering by category, etc.
fields.summary: Enhance 'Project Category' functionalty (versions/components/roadmap) and allow nested categories

I need to open 90+ users one by one and remove them from the groups. (Minimum 1 hour)

Are there any plans to improve group managability? The ability to add a group to a group would be very usefull too.

fields.description:
When reporting against a project plan, there are normally two pieces of information that you want to know, to forward project the targets.
    1. How much work did that person mamage to do on each task.
    2. How much work is remaining. 
You collect the first piece of information very effectively.

However, the figure you collect for 'Remaining Work' is highly likely to be the total figure minus the hours worked; until near the end of the project when it becomes say '3 weeks' every week for '3 months' because the size of the project is not being correctly adjusted. 

If instead, you collect the 'Percentage Complete', you force the developer to think through what they are doing in a slightly different framework from the 'time spent' framework. This figure can then be used to calculate the 'Remaining Work', giving a significantly better estimate, even if calculated from the original 'total Task Size'. 
        Remaining = (100-Percentage Done) * Original Total Estimate / 100.

I personnally like to take the 'percentage complete' and the total work done so far and recalculate a new estimate.
        New Total Estimate = (100/Percentage Done) * Total work done todate.
        Remaining = New Total Estimate - Total work done todate.

However, it also leaves a manager able to apply off-line, rules such as:
        No percentage between 51 and 99 percent will be accepted. 
This rule then forces people working on tasks significantly bigger than two reporting periods, to split their work down, so that some part of the task can be entered as 100% complete. This also smooths out some of the more wild fluctuations of the second method above.

If the reported figures after the entry of the work done and percentage, were displayed exactly as at the moment, it would work and be simple. 
However, adding in a fourth figure = percentage done (or 'to be done') would be better.  I suspect that the latter solution would cause a change in your data table for the reports.

Gil Rooke
fields.summary: Allow 'Percentage complete' to be reported instead of 'Work Remaining.

fields.description:
When writing custom fields, it would be nice to be able to specify configuration options much the same way you can with workflow transition conditions.

for example, I created a computed field type that shows when an issue enters a specific status. I had to create an abstract class and six concrete classes to implement for each of "Open" "In Progress" "Reopened" "Resolved" and "Closed".  This muddied up the custom field types screen too. 

It would be better if I could define a single custom field and have a configuration screen where the user can specify which status to use -- especially considering users can define their own statuses!!
fields.summary: configuring custom fields

{panel:title=27 March 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

Thanks for your feedback on this feature request. Unfortunately it is not currently on our roadmap; however we are interested in your feedback so we can consider it for the future. There are several third-party add-ons that provide this function:

h3. JIRA Cloud
* [JQL Search Extensions|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jql-extensions/cloud/overview]
* [Script Runner|http://scriptrunner-docs.connect.adaptavist.com/jiracloud/jql-aliases.html#_numberofattachments]

h3. JIRA Server
* [Script Runner|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.onresolve.jira.groovy.groovyrunner/server/overview]
* [J-Tricks|http://www.j-tricks.com/jql-tricks-plugin.html]

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.


Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Management
{panel}

Also the ability to search for particular attachment by name (and pattern) would be handy too.
fields.summary: Search for issues with attachment (by attachment presence)

fields.description:
AttachFile.java attempts to create a temporary directory where the source file is located to which a copy of the source file will be placed. If you only have read permissions to the source directory the process fails.

On fail the Class should instead create a temp directory in the attachments path (if defined) from the administration settings.
fields.summary: Jelly AttachFile tag requires write permission to source directory.

fields.description:
From the mailing list:

"Unfortunately, it is not possible to specify the "starting time" of a
subscription through JIRA's UI. You should be able to edit the "lastRun"
column of the "filtersubscription" table to "dummy" the last run value."

Would it possible to specify when you want the subcriptions to start from? As it stands if I want a report sent to me every week at thursday lunch, I either have to kick the filter subscription off at thursday lunch time, or hack the database.

Thanks.

fields.description:
When I try to create a subtask of an issue which is in a project with issue level security, I get the following error:

===
Form Errors:  Security Level is required. The "Set Issue Security" permission is required in order to set this field.
===

The project has:

- a permission scheme where my user is in a group that has the "Set Security Level" permission
- an issue level security scheme 

I can create an issue in this project.  I can edit the issue's "Security Level" field. But when I try to create a subtask of the issue, I receive the error.
fields.summary: Unable to Create Subtask of Issue in project with Issue Level Security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5680].
  {panel}

I would be helpful if you could define multiple releases per version. For Example:
3.0 (Version)
   |_ 3.0 RC1 (Release)
   |_ 3.0 RC2 (Release)
   |_ 3.0 Final (Release)

This would enable logging issues against the release (1.0 RC1 etc) rather than the version and still be able to generate release notes for the version which would include all issues logged againts all releases for the version.

This would also be helpful for using JIRA for planning. You could schedule each release and track progress by release. You should be able see overall progress for the version as well.
fields.summary: Multiple releases per version

fields.description: A user reports getting OutOfMemoryErrors while using pserver to retrieve a large amount (246Mb) of CVS logs.  Increasing the memory (up to 1Gb) does not help.  The log file parses easily (in 220Mb) when downloaded locally.  It seems that there may be a memory leak in the javacvs library.
fields.summary: OutOfMemoryErrors when fetching large CVS logs via pserver

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-5667].
  {panel}

Distributions should come with a Quick Start import.

JIRA should still ship with the "default" features turned on with no projects. However, there should also be other JIRA export files that quickly showcases the full feature set of JIRA and/or alternative uses for JIRA. Some example imports could be:

* JIRA Enterprise MAX - An import with all features utilised with some sample data to make meaningful reports (work load etc)
* JIRA Support - Using JIRA as a support tool, not just an issue tracker
* JIRA Workflow - Using JIRA as a workflow manager. (eg Cases instead of Issue) 

I think this will require changes to the import to allow for import files with no license (user would need to get their own trial license).
fields.summary: Distributions should come with a Quick Start import to showcase JIRA features
